name: Developing and Using Models
title: Develop a model to predict and/or describe phenomena

name: Developing and Using Models
title: Develop a model to describe unobservable mechanisms

name: Developing and Using Models
title: Develop a model to generate data to test ideas about designed systems, including those representing inputs and outputs.

name: Analyzing and Interpreting Data
title: Analyze and interpret data to determine similarities and differences in findings.

name: Analyzing and Interpreting Data
title: Construct and interpret graphical displays of data to identify linear and nonlinear relationships.

name: Analyzing and Interpreting Data
title: Analyze and interpret data to provide evidence for phenomena.

name: Analyzing and Interpreting Data
title: Analyze displays of data to identify linear and nonlinear relationships.

name: Scientific Knowledge is Based on Empirical Evidence
title: Science knowledge is based upon logical connections between evidence and explanations.

name: Scientific Knowledge is Based on Empirical Evidence
title: Science knowledge is based upon logical and conceptual connections between evidence and explanations

name: Scientific Knowledge is Based on Empirical Evidence
title: Science disciplines share common rules of obtaining and evaluating empirical evidence.

name: Obtaining, Evaluating, and Communicating Information
title: Gather, read, and synthesize information from multiple appropriate sources and assess the credibility, accuracy, and possible bias of each publication and methods used, and describe how they are supported or now supported by evidence.

name: Obtaining, Evaluating, and Communicating Information
title: Integrate qualitative scientific and technical information in written text with that contained in media and visual displays to clarify claims and findings.

name: Science Models, Laws, Mechanisms, and Theories Explain Natural Phenomena
title: Laws are regularities or mathematical descriptions of natural phenomena.

name: Science Models, Laws, Mechanisms, and Theories Explain Natural Phenomena
title: Science findings are frequently revised and/or reinterpreted based on new evidence.

name: Constructing Explanations and Designing Solutions
title: Construct a scientific explanation based on valid and reliable evidence obtained from sources (including the studentsâ€™ own experiments) and the assumption that theories and laws that describe the natural world operate today as they did in the past and will continue to do so in the future.

name: Constructing Explanations and Designing Solutions
title: Construct an explanation that includes qualitative or quantitative relationships between variables that predict phenomena.

name: Constructing Explanations and Designing Solutions
title: Construct an explanation that includes qualitative or quantitative relationships between variables that describe phenomena.

name: Constructing Explanations and Designing Solutions
title: Apply scientific ideas to construct an explanation for real-world phenomena, examples, or events.

name: Constructing Explanations and Designing Solutions
title: Apply scientific principles to design an object, tool, process or system.

name: Constructing Explanations and Designing Solutions
title: Apply scientific ideas or principles to design, construct, and test a design of an object, tool, process or system.

name: Constructing Explanations and Designing Solutions
title: Undertake a design project, engaging in the design cycle, to construct and/or implement a solution that meets specific design criteria and constraints.

name: Planning and Carrying Out Investigations (investigations that use multiple variables)
title: Plan an investigation individually and collaboratively, and in the design: identify independent and dependent variables and controls, what tools are needed to do the gathering, how measurements will be recorded, and how many data are needed to support a claim.

name: Planning and Carrying Out Investigations (investigations that use multiple variables)
title: Conduct an investigation and evaluate the experimental design to produce data to serve as the basis for evidence that can meet the goals of the investigation.

name: Planning and Carrying Out Investigations (investigations that use multiple variables)
title: Conduct an investigation to produce data to serve as the basis for evidence that meet the goals of an investigation.

name: Planning and Carrying Out Investigations (investigations that use multiple variables)
title: Collect data to produce data to serve as the basis for evidence to answer scientific questions or test design solutions under a range of conditions.

name: Asking Questions and Defining Problems
title: Ask questions that can be investigated within the scope of the classroom, outdoor environment, and museums and other public facilities with available resources and, when appropriate, frame a hypothesis based on observations and scientific principles.

name: Asking Questions and Defining Problems
title: Ask questions to identify and clarify evidence of an argument.

name: Asking Questions and Defining Problems
title: Define a design problem that can be solved through the development of an object, tool, process or system and includes multiple criteria and constraints, including scientific knowledge that may limit possible solutions.

name: Engaging in Argument from Evidence
title: Construct and present oral and written arguments supported by empirical evidence and scientific reasoning to support or refute an explanation or a model for a phenomenon or a solution to a problem.

name: Engaging in Argument from Evidence
title: Construct, use, and present oral and written arguments supported by empirical evidence and scientific reasoning to support or refute an explanation or a model for a phenomenon.

name: Engaging in Argument from Evidence
title: Use an oral and written argument supported by evidence to support or refute an explanation or a model for a phenomenon.

name: Engaging in Argument from Evidence
title: Use an oral and written argument supported by empirical evidence and scientific reasoning to support or refute an explanation or a model for a phenomenon or a solution to a problem.

name: Engaging in Argument from Evidence
title: Construct an oral and written argument supported by empirical evidence and scientific reasoning to support or refute an explanation or a model for a phenomenon or a solution to a problem.

name: Engaging in Argument from Evidence
title: Evaluate competing design solutions based on jointly developed and agreed-upon design criteria.

name: Using Mathematics and Computational Thinking (identifying patterns in large data sets)
title: Use mathematical representations to describe and/or support scientific conclusions and design solutions.

name: Using Mathematics and Computational Thinking (identifying patterns in large data sets)
title: Use mathematical representations to support scientific conclusions and design solutions.
